content: frankie s knitted stuff shawl for faye crochet half a big granny square and you get a triangular shawl this is a lovely project for playing with colours my finished shawl is 168 cm wide and 81 cm deep 66 × 32 and uses about 450 g of dk weight yarn all together the yarn i chose eight shades of reds pinks and browns for my shawl and then a pale cream with a hint of yellow as my contrast colour c the yarn i used was stylecraft special dk 295 m / 100g in the following colours from left to right burgundy 1 claret 2 lipstick 3 pomegranate 4 blush 5 stone 6 mocha 7 and walnut 8 i ve numbered the colours so that you can substitute others and still follow my colour plan my contrast colour c is toy you will need 50g of the eight colours and about 60g of the contrast the pattern this pattern uses british crochet terms treble_crochet = us double_crochet double_crochet = us single_crochet i used a 3 5 mm crochet hook for my shawl i ll explain the crochet first and then give details of my colour plan using burgundy colour 1 make 4 chain and join with a slip stitch into a ring row 1 5ch 3tr 2ch 3tr in ring row 2 5ch 3tr in first st 1ch 3tr 2ch 3tr in corner 1ch 3tr in 5ch space change colour before the next row do this by working the last part of the last treble in the new colour that means pulling the new colour through the last two loops on the hook so now using claret colour 2 … row 3 5ch 3tr in first st 1ch 3tr in space 1ch 3tr 2ch 3tr in corner 1ch 3tr in space 1ch 3tr in 5ch space row 4 5ch 3tr in first st 1ch 3tr 1ch in side spaces 1ch 3tr 2ch 3tr in corner 1ch 3tr 1ch in side spaces 3tr in 5ch space from now on you just repeat row 4 for the rest of the shawl changing colour when needed my colour plan i worked through my eight colours in order working two row in the first two colours followed by one row in the next colour and then one row in the contrast colour here you can see that i started with two row of burgundy and claret colours 1 & 2 followed by one row of lipstick colour 3 and then one row of toy c the first set of row using all the colours is row 1&2 burgundy colour 1 row 3 & 4 claret colour 2 row 5 lipstick colour 3 row 6 toy c row 7 & 8 pomegranate colour 4 row 9 & 10 blush colour 5 row 11 stone colour 6 row 12 toy c row 13 & 14 mocha colour 7 row 15 & 16 walnut colour 8 as you re working a six row pattern repeat with
